alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 3:32PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TUESDAY TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory tonight through noon Tuesday, very cold wind chills as low as 15 to 30 below zero are expected across south central Nebraska and wind chills as low as 15 to 20 below zero are expected across north central Kansas. For the Wind Chill Advisory Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning, very cold wind chills as low as 20 to 30 below zero are expected across south central Nebraska and wind chills as low as 20 below zero are expected across north central Kansas. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Tuesday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM Tuesday to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
